name: Gregory Wadley
content: Greg Wadley, University of Melbourne Greg Wadley, Faculty of Engineering and IT, University of Melbourne Work I research across computing, psychology and medical disciplines, including co-design and evaluation of digital health interventions. I teach into the UX major in UM's Bachelor of Design. My service work has included co-chairing the CHI Health Subcommittee (2022-3) and co-organising CHI symposia on Computing and Mental Health (2016-9). I hold degrees in human-computer interaction (PhD), cognitive science (MSc) and computer science (BSc). Recent Samangi Wadinambiarachchi et al. (2025) Imagining Design Workflows in Agentic AI Futures. OzCHI 2025 Piumi Perera et al. (2025) Towards reciprocity: Mediating human-nature relations through HCI. OzCHI 2025 Late-Breaking Work Jonathon Rawstorn et al. (2025) Citizen science informed online platform to increase social connection, physical health, and mental wellbeing in people with disability and carers: ConnectUp project protocol. Disability and Rehabilitation Melissa Keller-Tuberg et al. (2025) A qualitative study of youth mental health service users' views on the delivery of psychological interventions via virtual worlds. Virtual Worlds the Parkinson's B-eye-omarker team won UniMelb's 2025 Award for Excellence in Interdisciplinary Research Contact email: greg.wadley at unimelb.edu.au office: Room 5326, Melbourne Connect 700 Swanston Street VIC 3010, Australia
